reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. For the price that we paid and the central location, I would say that the hotel needs some refurbishment... some of the furniture in the lobby was in much need of updating. Our room was clean and a good size, but again a little bit tatty- the wallpaper and wood fixtures being the main culprits.
reviews.title: Good location but needs refurbishment

reviews.text: Don't pay for an expensive taxi from the airport to the hotel as it is very close.. instead take a public bus which drops you right opposite the hotel. A ghue department store is also opposite the hotel (although closed on Sundays) along with other shops and cinema nearby. Lots of cafes and restaurants around too, and Central Seville not too far a walk, although there is also a metro station about 5 minutes walk away.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A really great stay at this hotel exellent beds amazing location good food but to be one of the best hotels i've been in the should add a free wifi in the rooms and the employees are so nice.
reviews.title: regular hotel

reviews.text: It takes 2 min walking from this hotel to the centre of seville
reviews.title: Very poor quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed for 2 nights in july in a standard room, although the decoration is old, in the room everything was OK. The areo of the swimming pool is very nice so It was nice to spend a hot day over there. The breakfast was excellent with a lot of choice of food.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with good amenities; slightly far from old town Sevilla

reviews.text: Huge hotel in a location near the FC Sevilla stadium. The hotel lobby and bar are the best bits of this hotel. The rooms and other areas are getting very tired and in need of a refurb. My room smelt distinctly musty and damp when I walked into it. The air conditioning was dripping water on the floor and there was a damp patch on the carpet underneath which probably explained the smell. It suggested that there was a general lack of maintenance and the room was really quite worn in other areas too like the wallpaper coming off the walls around the window area. Food was distinctly average. Much of the buffet breakfast and lunches were very dated in content and presentation (think 1970's), and quite often the hot items were allowed to go cold and not very nice. The bar staff were quite unfriendly and it seemed deliberately slow if you dared to try and attract their attention.
reviews.title: More like the Smellia Lebreros
Tired but ok for business
reviews.text: Just spent three nights at the hotel. Location is a bit away from the old town so you need a taxi to go there (old town is excellent for restaurants and bars). The hotel itself is getting old and pretty tired. Good spacious lounge areas, a decent bar (very slow service) and very large conference facilities, makes this a pretty useful hotel for business. However the normal rooms are very dated, beds are so so and the bathrooms have seen better days, so if on leisure travel then that would be a different thing for me.

Several items in room did not work and the front desk staff could care less. Finally got them to replace in-room safe that was on the blitz. Wallpaper was old and stained and had been patched in many places with newer wallpaper of the same design. The room was clean, but because everything was so worn out, I didn't want to touch anything. Just yucky.
reviews.title: Very tired, old hotel in need of update

reviews.text: Arriving in the evening, tired after a long day and travel, the welcome was not impressive. Not a glimmer of a welcome or a smile. Purely functional and made to wait while discussions continued behind the counter. The key did not work so back, to re-queue for another unfriendly desk clerk. There was no acknowledgement when I told them my key didnt work but then a clerk appeared near me to; he did not speak but I assumed we should go to the room. No discussion, offer of assistance with my luggage etc. The door seemed slightly stuck and the employee seemed aware of the issue...a bit of force and we got in. Again without a word being spoken-this is not welcoming!
reviews.title: Average hotel, tired in many places

reviews.text: The room once probably looked lovely, but the wonky light, very dated and worn desk etc showed how tired this hotel is getting. The bed and the linen used however was lovely-very comfortable and I slept very well.
reviews.title: Not as good as it looks in the photos..
Nice spot to visit Sevilla, even if a little far from the old town
reviews.text: The hotel was quite good, with big and clean bedroom and bathroom, an OK wifi connection and a silent and efficient air conditionning (without which I think we would have died since it was 45°C outside, even though we went there in may). We only took the breakfast there and it was good also, with a big choice of salty and sugary, even though the viennese pastries, even if there was a great choice, were not very good.

reviews.title: You can go back home again
reviews.text: Take note that the hotel is located in a shopping area and is a 15 minutes walk 10 minutes by subway to the old city, which can be a showstopper for many. Our tip is that you register for the length of your stay to SEBICI, the local urban bike renting facility, which is GREAT in this town, with stations every 100/200 meters, and brand new cycle tracks everywhere : it was a pleasure to visit the town and the parks by bycicle, we recommand it to those who can do it!

reviews.title: Convenient location
reviews.text: Only downside note : we booked the hotel knowing that there was a swimming pool, but it was closed during our stay there since "it's not June but May and so it's not the season for the swimming pool"... too bad : if 45°C full sun is not swimming pool season, I don't know what is -_-'

reviews.title: Nice hotel
reviews.text: In May, we had the awesome experience to stay at the Malia Lebreros Hotel in Seville, Spain. The moment we entered the Lobby it felt like we were at home. The staff was friendly and went out of their way to make us feel welcomed. The lobby was spotless and beautifully decorated in a modern décor. The Head of the Quality Department, Ms. Elena Toral was extremely attentive, caring and professional. She spoke perfect English and instantly Goggled places in the city for us to visit and gave wonderful directions which made walking and riding the local buses easy. She instantly answered any questions about Seville, in essence she became our “Tour Guide.”

reviews.title: Lot of potential, after serious refurbishment
reviews.text: The Breakfast Buffet was awesome, serving over thirty to forty items. The Dining Room/Waiter Staff Supervisor was courteous and gladly identified items on the menu. The bedroom was spotless and the Maid left the room clean with fresh towels and toiletries. I would highly recommend the Melia Lebreros Hotel to anyone visiting Seville. Another plus is that the Hotel is directly across the street from the El Cortes Ingles, the finest and largest full Department Store in Spain with a complete Super Market and Bakery on the lower level.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our most recent stay at this large Seville hotel, en route from Portugal to Santander for the ferry to the UK.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.text: Maite, the receptionist, was friendly and competent, helping us by finding and booking a hotel for the next part of our journey northwards.
reviews.title: I can't believe there are negative comments about this place - I thought it was brilliant!

reviews.text: It's large and could be a bit impersonal, but we felt welcomed and valued.
reviews.title: Hotel was fine, but never use the phone!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is good, although the coffee machines are not designed for frequent use!
reviews.title: OK, but would not stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location, near the Nervion Metro station, is convenient for going into Santa Cruz, and for driving in/out of the city.
reviews.title: Lovely Premium room - great value - recommended - restaurant could be better.
